C.title: Consequence
C.description: In the context of a data project, this refers to an outcome or result, whether positive or negative, that can occur as a direct or indirect effect of project actions or decisions.

D.title: Data project
D.description: A specific initiative focused on working with data, often involving data collection, analysis, and the pursuit of particular goals or objectives.

D.title: Data lifecycle
D.description: The stages through which data passes, from its creation or acquisition to its disposal or archiving.

E.title: External factors
E.description: Events or conditions outside the project that can impact the project's outcomes, such as changes in regulations, market conditions, or technological advancements.

I.title: Impact
I.description: The effect or influence that a consequence may have on a project, stakeholders, data, or other relevant aspects. Impact can be categorised as low, medium, or high.

I.title: Intended consequences
I.description: Positive outcomes that a project aims to achieve, aligned with its objectives and goals.

K.title: Key performance indicator (KPI)
K.description: A measurable metric that indicates the success or progress of a specific action or outcome. KPIs are used to track and evaluate performance in various aspects of a project.

L.title: Likelihood
L.description: The probability or chance of a consequence occurring. Likelihood can be categorised as low, medium, or high.

M.title: Mitigation action
M.description: Specific steps or measures taken to reduce the impact or likelihood of a risk consequence.

O.title: Objectives
O.description: Specific, measurable goals and desired outcomes that the project aims to achieve.

P.title: Project overview
P.description: A concise summary of the data project, including its purpose, goals, and context.

R.title: Risk register
R.description: A document that centralises information related to the assessment and management of risks in a project. It typically includes details about project objectives, stakeholders, identified consequences, and risk management strategies.

R.title: Risk assessment
R.description: The process of evaluating the potential impact and likelihood of identified risks in a project to prioritise and manage them effectively.

R.title: Risk management
R.description: The systematic process of identifying, assessing, mitigating, and monitoring risks to achieve project objectives and minimise negative impacts.

R.title: Risk management table
R.description: A structured format for categorising and managing identified consequences, typically including information on impact, likelihood, mitigation actions, and KPIs.

R.title: Risk priority
R.description: Assigning priority levels to risks or actions to indicate their relative importance or urgency.

R.title: Regulatory and compliance requirements
R.description: Legal or industry-specific rules and standards that the project must adhere to when handling data.

S.title: Stakeholders
S.description: Individuals, teams, or organisations involved in or affected by the project. They can be categorised as internal or external stakeholders.

U.title: Unintended consequences
U.description: Results, both positive and negative, that are unexpected or unforeseen and may arise during a project's execution.
